chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
V: Type

Goal:
Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set ==> Same_set) (Union V)

Premises:
Same_set = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => Included B C /\ Included C B : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Argument U is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Proper = let U := Type in fun (A : U) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (m : A) => R m m : forall A : Type, Relation_Definitions.relation A -> A -> Prop Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope signature_scope _]
Union : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Ensemble U
complement_proper : forall V : Type, Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set) (Complement V)
Included_proper : forall V : Type, Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set ==> iff) Included
Union_assoc : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Union A (Union A P Q) R) (Union A P (Union A Q R))
Union_comm : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Union A P Q) (Union A Q P)
Intersection_Union_distr_l : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Union A Q R) P) (Union A (Intersection A Q P) (Intersection A R P))
Intersection_Union_distr_r : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A P (Union A Q R)) (Union A (Intersection A P Q) (Intersection A P R))
Intersection_Complement : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Complement A P) (Complement A Q)) (Complement A (Union A P Q))
Same_set_rel_Transitive = fun A : Type => Same_set_trans A : forall A : Type, Transitive Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Same_set_rel_Symmetric = fun A : Type => Same_set_sym A : forall A : Type, Symmetric Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Same_set_rel_Reflexive = fun A : Type => Same_set_refl A : forall A : Type, Reflexive Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Same_set_rel_relation = fun A : Type => {| |} : forall A : Type, RewriteRelation Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Same_set_rel = fun A : Type => {| Equivalence_Reflexive := Same_set_refl A; Equivalence_Symmetric := Same_set_sym A; Equivalence_Transitive := Same_set_trans A |} : forall A : Type, Equivalence Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Ensemble = fun U : Type => U -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
SetoidList.InfA_compat : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop), Equivalence eqA -> forall ltA : A -> A -> Prop, Proper (eqA ==> eqA ==> iff) ltA -> Proper (eqA ==> SetoidList.eqlistA eqA ==> iff) (Sorted.HdRel ltA)
PeanoNat.Nat.testbit_wd = PeanoNat.Nat.testbit_wd_obligation_1 : Proper (eq ==> eq ==> eq) PeanoNat.Nat.testbit
BinInt.Z.lt_compat = BinInt.Z.lt_wd : Proper (eq ==> eq ==> iff) BinInt.Z.lt
PeanoNat.Nat.lt_wd = PeanoNat.Nat.lt_wd_obligation_1 : Proper (eq ==> eq ==> iff) lt
BinInt.Z.pow_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.pow : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq) BinInt.Z.pow
BinInt.Z.div_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.div : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq) BinInt.Z.div
BinNat.N.testbit_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.testbit : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> eq) BinNat.N.testbit
BinInt.Z.mul_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.mul : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq) BinInt.Z.mul
BinNat.N.add_wd = reflexive_proper BinNat.N.add : Proper (BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq ==> BinNat.N.eq) BinNat.N.add
BinInt.Z.testbit_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.testbit : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> eq) BinInt.Z.testbit
BinInt.Z.add_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.add : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq) BinInt.Z.add
BinInt.Z.lt_wd = reflexive_proper BinInt.Z.lt : Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> BinInt.Z.eq ==> iff) BinInt.Z.lt
Record ring_eq_ext (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_reqe { Radd_ext : Proper (req ==> req ==> req) radd; Rmul_ext : Proper (req ==> req ==> req) rmul; Ropp_ext : Proper (req ==> req) ropp } For ring_eq_ext: Argument R is implicit For mk_reqe: Arguments R, radd, rmul, ropp, req are implicit For ring_eq_ext: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope] For mk_reqe: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope function_scope _ _ _]
PeanoNat.Nat.Rlt_wd : forall z : nat, Proper (eq ==> eq ==> iff) (fun n m : nat => z <= n < m)
SetoidList.InA_compat : forall (A : Type) (eqA : A -> A -> Prop), Equivalence eqA -> Proper (eqA ==> SetoidList.equivlistA eqA ==> iff) (SetoidList.InA eqA)
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt = BinNums.positive : Type
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t = FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree : Type

intros??.
